title: Prayer for Protection
shortSummary: Psalm 141 is a heartfelt prayer of David, asking the Lord for swift help, protection from evil, and guidance in righteous living. The psalm emphasizes the power of prayer, the importance of guarding one's speech, and trusting God amidst adversity.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The author of the psalm, a king of Israel known for his deep reliance on God and his poetic prayers.

keyCharacters.name: The Righteous
keyCharacters.description: Those who uphold God's law and discipline the psalmist for his spiritual growth.

keyCharacters.name: Workers of Iniquity
keyCharacters.description: Evil men who oppose the psalmist and seek to trap him in sin.

definitions.definition: A fragrant substance burned as an offering, symbolizing prayers ascending to God.
The daily burnt offering made at twilight in the temple, representing worship and atonement.
A request for God’s protection over one’s speech to prevent sinful words.
Traps or snares set by enemies to cause harm or entrapment.

outline.heading: David’s Plea for God’s Attention and Swift Help
outline.description: David begins by urgently calling on the Lord to hear his prayer, likening it to incense and a sacred evening sacrifice, highlighting the reverence and persistence in prayer.

outline.heading: Prayer for Guarding Speech and Heart
outline.description: David asks God to set a watch over his mouth and keep his lips from evil, expressing a desire to avoid sinful associations and temptations.

outline.heading: Accepting Righteous Correction
outline.description: David welcomes discipline from the righteous as a kindness and healing oil, showing humility and trust that his prayers will continue even in others’ troubles.

outline.heading: Reflection on Mortality and Trust in God
outline.description: David acknowledges human frailty and death but fixes his eyes on God, expressing unwavering trust and a plea not to be abandoned.

outline.heading: Request for Deliverance from Evil
outline.description: The psalm concludes with a plea for protection from the snares of evildoers and a confident request that the wicked fall into their own traps while the psalmist escapes.

application: Approach God with urgency and reverence in prayer, knowing He hears and values our petitions.
Guard your speech carefully, asking God to help you avoid sinful words and harmful associations.
Accept correction from godly people as a means of spiritual growth and healing.
Trust God fully in times of trouble, keeping your eyes fixed on Him for deliverance and strength.

keyVerses.text: Set a watch, O LORD, before my mouth; keep the door of my lips.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the importance of controlling one’s speech and relying on God’s help to avoid sin.

keyVerses.text: Let the righteous smite me; it shall be a kindness: and let him reprove me; it shall be an excellent oil, which shall not break my head: for yet my prayer also shall be in their calamities.
keyVerses.significance: David shows humility by welcoming godly correction as beneficial and healing.

keyVerses.text: But mine eyes are unto thee, O GOD the Lord: in thee is my trust; leave not my soul destitute.
keyVerses.significance: This verse expresses steadfast trust in God’s provision and presence even in difficult times.

keyVerses.text: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, whilst that I withal escape.
keyVerses.significance: David prays for divine justice and deliverance from the traps set by evildoers.
